description: One of my favourite two player games. If you haven't played it you should.
Good 2-player game, simple mechanics so easy to learn but lots to think about when trying to outplay your opponent.  Nice art, nice inoffensive theme that doesn’t really matter but nice eye candy.

title: Fun little...
description: Fun little 2-player card game of risk vs. reward.  Your goals must not be spread out over too many excavations, as there is only a limited amount of cards shared by both players.  Quick game, but drawback is it's only 2-player (well, unless you buy another copy of the game).  One mechanic I like is that you must either play OR discard a card on your turn. Your opponent can then choose to take the card you discarded.  I also like how the game is light, small and easy to set up and plays quickly.

title: A fun game...
description: A fun game, though it's lacking in a little bit of depth.  Although my wife destroys me at this all the time, so that might be why I'm not enthralled at this game.

title: I've never...
description: I've never felt such intense personal hatred from a game. I don't hate it back, but until it can find it in its heart to let me beat my wife just ONCE, I refuse to raise its rating.

title: This seems...
description: This seems very luck driven at first, but there is a surprising amount of strategy involved.  It can get pretty mathy at times so I recommend downloading the free Lost Cities scoring app. It makes scoring very easy

title: Having pla...
description: Having played numerous games, most of which online, I think it's fair to say that this is one of my favourite two player games. The rules are very simple and the luck factor is definitely there (as you draw cards and have to play one each turn), but it is certainly a game where some skill is involved. You try to focus on a few colours, as you pay 20 points for every colour you start. However, you don't want to show early on which colours you'll be playing, trying to entice your opponent to throw out the card you need.I'm a fan of Knizia's work and this game is certainly one of my favourites, although Euphrate & Tigris and -to a lesser extent- Genius are also very enjoyable.

description: Quick, fun game, where you're regularly confronted with extremely tough decisions. My wife regularly kicks my butt in this game!
